check.name: UnnecessaryPermitsClause
check.description:
Checks for unnecessary permits clauses in sealed classes and interfaces.

In the Java programming language, a sealed type may specify a permits clause to explicitly list all allowed subclasses. The permits clause is optional if all permitted types are nested or declared within the same file.

This check tracks:

  • the permitted types listed in the permits clause of a sealed type
  • all subclasses/implementations found in the same file
If all permitted types are found in the same compilation unit, a violation is logged.
